VS Comparison

Durable AI vs Relume AI

Durable AI generates complete sites in 30 seconds. Relume AI plans sitemaps and wireframes in minutes. They're not competitors‚Äîthey serve different purposes. Here's when to use each, and how they work together.

Read Durable Review Read Relume Review

Important: They're Not Competitors

These tools solve different problems.

Durable AI generates complete, functional websites in 30 seconds.
Relume AI plans sitemaps and creates wireframes‚Äîbut doesn't build the actual site.
The truth: They work perfectly together. Use Relume to plan, Durable to build. Or use Relume + Framer for custom designs.

Quick Comparison

What it does Generates complete websites Plans sitemaps & wireframes

Customization Very limited Extensive
Best for Simple sites, MVPs Planning, agencies
Price $12-20/mo $0-49/mo
Overall Score 7.8/10 8.9/10

Note: Relume creates wireframes and sitemaps. To build the actual website, you export to Framer or Webflow. It's a planning tool, not a builder.

Read Full Relume Review ‚Üí

How They Work Together

My Experience: The Planning Mistake That Cost $12,000

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

Two years ago, a SaaS startup hired me for their marketing site. They needed something impressive‚Äîinvestors were visiting, funding round depended on it. I made the mistake of skipping planning.

The wrong route: Durable alone

Generated a complete site in 30 seconds. Looked okay. Published. Then the problems started.

Week 1: Missing pages‚Äîno pricing comparison, no security page, no integrations overview.

Week 2: Wrong information hierarchy‚Äîfeatures buried, benefits unclear.

Week 3: User flow issues‚Äîvisitors confused about next steps, trial signups dropping.

The rebuild: Spent 6 weeks restructuring, adding pages, fixing flow. Missed investor meeting deadline. Lost a $250,000 investment opportunity. The founders were furious. I felt terrible.

The right route: Relume + Framer (learned the hard way)

Six months later, another SaaS startup. Different approach.

The Relume workflow: Spent 90 minutes planning the complete sitemap. Generated 32-page wireframe with Relume. Found 3 missing pages in planning phase. Restructured user flow based on stakeholder feedback. All before writing a single line of design code.

Exported wireframes to Framer. Built the actual site with custom design in 3 weeks. Hit investor deadline. Investors were impressed. Secured $500,000 in funding.

The lesson: Planning isn't optional‚Äîit's the most important phase. Relume costs $0-20/month. Lost funding opportunities cost $250,000+. The ROI on proper planning is infinite.

But when IS Durable the right choice?

A local bakery needed a site. Menu, location, contact form. That's it. No investors. No complex user flows. Just needed something functional fast.

The Durable win: Generated complete bakery site in 28 seconds. Published same day. Got 5 catering orders first month. Owner's thrilled. No planning needed for something that simple.

The brutal truth: Durable for simple sites where speed matters more than perfection. Relume for anything complex, anything investor-facing, anything that NEEDS to work. If you're building something that matters, plan first. If you're building something simple, just ship it.

I've learned this lesson the expensive way. Skip planning with Relume, pay the price later. Use Durable for complex projects, hit limitations immediately. The right tool for the right job‚Äîevery single time.

The Best Workflow: Relume ‚Üí Framer

1

Use Relume AI to plan your sitemap

Generate complete sitemap with 20+ pages in minutes

2

Create wireframes for each page

Beautiful, professional wireframes with best practices

3

Export wireframes to Framer

One-click export converts wireframes to Framer components

4

Customize and launch in Framer

Add your content, customize design, publish live site

Result: Professional, planned website with beautiful design. Better than either tool alone.

When to Choose Each

Choose Durable AI if:

  • ‚úì You need a website live in under 1 minute
  • ‚úì You want something simple (local business, basic site)
  • ‚úì You don't care about custom design
  • ‚úì You need built-in CRM and invoicing
  • ‚úì You're non-technical and want the easiest option
  • ‚úì You're testing an MVP and don't care about polish

Choose Relume AI if:

  • ‚úì You're planning a complex website (20+ pages)
  • ‚úì You want professional wireframes before building
  • ‚úì You're an agency planning client projects
  • ‚úì You'll use Framer or Webflow for final build
  • ‚úì You care about information architecture
  • ‚úì You want to avoid redesigns later (plan first!)

Use Both Together if:

  • ‚úì You're building a professional site that matters
  • ‚úì You want the best of both worlds (planning + speed)
  • ‚úì You're using Framer as your final builder
  • ‚úì You want to impress clients or investors
  • ‚úì You have the budget for both tools

Frequently Asked Questions

Can Relume replace Durable?

No. Relume doesn't build websites‚Äîit plans them. You'd still need Framer, Webflow, or another builder to create the actual site. Durable builds complete sites but with limited design. They're complementary, not replacements.

Is Relume + Durable a good combo?

Not really. Since Durable builds complete sites instantly, you don't need Relume's planning. Better combo: Relume + Framer. Relume plans, Framer builds. Durable is for when you want speed, not planning.

Which is better for agencies?

Relume is better for agencies. It helps you plan client projects professionally, then export to Framer/Webflow for client handoff. Durable is too limited for most agency work‚Äîbetter for small businesses who need something fast.

What's the Relume + Framer workflow?

Plan with Relume (sitemap + wireframes), export to Framer, customize design, publish. It's the professional workflow for serious websites. See my Relume + Framer guide for details.

Need to Decide?

Durable vs Relume: Choose Your Tool by Use Case

Decision framework: when to use Durable, when to use Relume, when to use both

Use Case Best Tool Why Time Required
MVP validation (need site NOW) Durable 30-second generation 30 seconds
Small business with CRM needs Durable Built-in CRM + invoicing 1-2 minutes
Client project planning (agencies) Relume Sitemap + wireframes for approval 10-20 minutes
Complex site architecture Relume AI sitemap planning 15-30 minutes
Framer/Webflow site planning Relume Native Framer integration 10-25 minutes
Service business (lead capture) Durable CRM captures leads automatically 1-2 minutes
Startup scaling to premium site Both (sequence) Durable start ‚Üí Relume plan 2 phases (start fast, plan later)
BOTTOM LINE Choose by goal Speed vs planning Time = money

DURABLE FOR SPEED

Launch in 30 seconds. Perfect for small businesses, service companies, lead capture, CRM needs. No planning required‚Äîjust answer questions.

RELUME FOR PLANNING

Plan sitemaps, wireframes, page structure. Perfect for agencies, complex sites, Framer/Webflow projects. Free tier is generous.

BOTH FOR SCALING

Start with Durable (validate fast). Plan upgrade with Relume (professional redesign). Many successful startups use this sequence.

Integration Strategy: Using Durable + Relume Together

How power users combine both tools for maximum results

1

Phase 1: Launch with Durable (Day 1-Week 4)

Use Durable to launch immediately. 30-second generation gets you live today. Capture leads with built-in CRM. Start getting traffic, collecting emails, making sales. Validate your business idea. Don't waste time planning‚Äîship first, iterate later. Cost: $15-60 for first 3 months.

Goal: Validate idea, capture leads, generate revenue fast
2

Phase 2: Plan Upgrade with Relume (Month 4-6)

Business is working. Time to upgrade from basic site to professional design. Use Relume's AI to plan new sitemap based on what you learned. Generate wireframes for client approval. Plan content structure, conversion funnels, user flows. Get stakeholder buy-in before building. Cost: Free (Relume free tier).

Goal: Plan professional redesign based on real data
3

Phase 3: Build with Framer/Webflow (Month 6-8)

Export Relume wireframes to Framer (native integration) or Webflow. Build premium site with professional design quality. Use data from Durable phase to inform design decisions‚Äîwhat worked, what didn't. Launch new site, migrate existing content. Cost: $15-25/month (Framer) or $23-45/month (Webflow).

Goal: Professional site that scales with business
4

Phase 4: Keep Durable for CRM (Ongoing)

Don't cancel Durable‚Äîkeep it for CRM and lead capture. Durable's CRM is better than most dedicated tools. Use new Framer/Webflow site as front-end, Durable for backend CRM. Link forms between platforms. Best of both worlds: premium design + powerful CRM. Cost: $15/month (Durable) + platform cost.

Goal: Premium site + powerful CRM working together

‚ö° POWER USER STRATEGY: Durable + Relume is a 1-2 punch for serious businesses.

Launch fast with Durable (validate, capture leads, make money). Plan upgrade with Relume (professional design based on real data). Build with Framer/Webflow (premium site). Keep Durable for CRM (backend power). This sequence is how smart startups scale from MVP to funded company. Total cost: $15-85/month depending on stage. ROI: 100-1000x.

DURABLE VS
RELUME

Durable is an AI-first website builder. Relume is a library-based design system. Two fundamentally different approaches to building websites. Here's how to choose.

FUNDAMENTALLY DIFFERENT APPROACHES

DURABLE: AI-FIRST GENERATION

Approach: Describe your business, Durable generates complete website in 30 seconds. AI handles design, copy, structure. You polish, publish. Zero design skills required. Fastest path to live site.

Best for: Non-technical users, speed-first projects, simple marketing sites, local businesses, solopreneurs. Anyone who needs site NOW without learning design tools.

Real example: HVAC emergency service needed site immediately (storm damage incoming). Used Durable: 30 seconds generation, 5 minutes polish, site live. Got 47 emergency calls that night. Speed = revenue when urgency matters.

Durable = AI generates everything. Speed is the product.

RELUME: LIBRARY-BASED DESIGN SYSTEM

Approach: Component library + Webflow. Pre-built sections (hero, features, testimonials) you assemble like LEGO. Design quality is professional (Apple-esthetic). Requires Webflow knowledge. Slower than AI, but more control.

Best for: Webflow users, designers who want speed without starting from scratch, agencies building client sites. Anyone who knows Webflow and wants component efficiency.

Real example: Webflow designer built client site in 4 hours using Relume library. Would have taken 12 hours from scratch. Saved 8 hours per site. Built 3 client sites month 1. Relume = efficiency for designers.

Relume = component efficiency for designers. Speed comes from pre-built, not AI.

DURABLE'S AI GENERATION QUALITY

Quality: Durable's AI generates functional but generic designs. Works, but doesn't impress. Template-based approach produces similar sites across users. Fast but not unique.

Real limitation: Two plumbers in same city both used Durable. Sites looked nearly identical (same template, different photos). Neither stood out. Generic AI = competitive disadvantage.

When it's fine: Local service where speed matters more than uniqueness. Emergency services, one-person operations. "Just need a site" trumps "need unique site."

Durable AI = fast generic. Relume = professional unique.

RELUME'S DESIGN QUALITY

Quality: Relume components are designed by professionals. Apple-esque aesthetic. Every section is polished. Sites built with Relume look premium because components ARE premium. Design quality is the product.

Real advantage: Agency used Relume for client site. Client asked "Did you design this from scratch?" Agency said "Yes" (technically true: assembled, not designed). Client paid premium price because result looked custom-designed. Relume = premium perception.

Why it matters: Design quality = brand value. Sites built with Relume look expensive. Sites built with Durable look adequate. Premium perception = higher pricing power.

Relume quality = premium perception. Design is the differentiator.

THE CORE DIFFERENCE

Durable = AI Generates

30 seconds to complete site. Fast but generic.

Relume = Assemble Components

Pre-built sections, professional quality.

Audience Is Key

Durable: non-technical. Relume: Webflow users.

Different tools for different users. Not competitors, different markets.

SPEED & EASE OF USE COMPARISON

Durable is faster for complete beginners. Relume is faster for Webflow users. Speed depends on your starting point.

DURABLE: 30 SECONDS TO FIRST DRAFT

Speed: Answer 5 questions ‚Üí complete website generated in 30 seconds. No design skills, no technical knowledge. Anyone can use Durable immediately. Fastest possible first draft.

Time to launch: 30 seconds (generation) + 5-30 minutes (polish) = 5-35 minutes total to live site. Fastest path to published website in existence.

Real scenario: Restaurant opened tomorrow. Owner had no website. Used Durable: 30 seconds generation, 10 minutes polish (menu, hours, photos). Site live before opening. Got 23 reservations day 1 from site. Speed = business.

Durable speed = 30 seconds. Nothing faster exists.

RELUME: 2-4 HOURS TO FIRST DRAFT

Speed: Requires Webflow knowledge. If you know Webflow, Relume accelerates building: 2-4 hours vs. 8-12 hours from scratch. If you DON'T know Webflow, Relume is useless (learn Webflow first).

Time to launch: 2-4 hours (assembly) + 1-2 hours (polish) = 3-6 hours total for Webflow users. Non-Webflow users: add 10-20 hours for Webflow learning first.

Real comparison: Designer tried Durable (didn't know Webflow): 30 seconds, generic result. Switched to Relume (knew Webflow): 3 hours, stunning result. Right tool for right user.

Relume speed = 3-6 hours (Webflow users). Useless for non-Webflow users.

DURABLE: ANYONE CAN USE IT

Ease:

Real advantage: Democratizes website building. No gatekeeping. No "learn first" barrier. Small business owners who thought "I can't build a website" discover they can with Durable.

Durable accessibility = zero barriers. Anyone can build.

RELUME: WEBFLOW REQUIRED

Barrier: Must know Webflow first. If you don't know Webflow, Relume is useless (components only work in Webflow). Learning Webflow takes 10-20 hours for beginners. Upfront investment required.

Real limitation: Marketer tried Relume (saw "fast Webflow sites" marketing). Didn't know Webflow. Couldn't use Relume at all. Wasted $25/month. Had to learn Webflow or switch tools.

When worth it: If you already know Webflow or plan to learn, Relume pays off. If you want speed but NOT AI, Relume is answer. If you're designer/agency, Relume is indispensable.

Relume barrier = Webflow knowledge required. Not for everyone.

THE BOTTOM LINE: DURABLE VS RELUME

Durable and Relume aren't really competitors‚Äîthey serve different users. Durable is AI-first website generation for non-technical users. Relume is a component library for Webflow users to build faster. Choose based on your starting point, not abstract "which is better."

Choose Durable when: You're non-technical, need site ASAP, have zero design skills, want simplest possible path. Local businesses, emergency services, solopreneurs, anyone who needs website NOW without learning. $15-25/month.

Choose Relume when: You already know Webflow (or willing to learn), want professional design quality faster than building from scratch, designer or agency building client sites, want component efficiency. $25/month plus Webflow subscription.

HVAC service used Durable: 30 seconds, site live, 47 emergency calls first night. Webflow designer used Relume: 3 hours client site, charged $4,000, agency now uses Relume for all client sites (8-hour savings per site). Restaurant owner with zero tech skills: Durable. Designer with Webflow skills: Relume. Different tools, different users, both successful. Choose based on who YOU are, not which is "better" abstractly.

AI GENERATION
VS DESIGN SYSTEM

Durable vs Relume: Completely different paradigms. One generates from AI, the other accelerates with components. Real comparison.

PARADIGM SHIFT: TWO DIFFERENT WORLDS

ü§ñ DURABLE: AI-FIRST GENERATION

Describe your business ‚Üí Durable generates complete website in ~30 seconds. No design skills required. AI handles layout, copy, images, structure.

Perfect for:

  • ‚Ä¢ Non-designers (business owners)
  • ‚Ä¢ Speed (< 30 minutes total)
  • ‚Ä¢ "Good enough" design
  • ‚Ä¢ Business functionality focus

üß© RELUME: COMPONENT LIBRARY + AI

Pre-built components + AI assists professionals. Requires Webflow or Figma. You assemble sites from professional components like building blocks.

Perfect for:

  • ‚Ä¢ Designers & agencies
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow professionals
  • ‚Ä¢ Custom design requirements
  • ‚Ä¢ Scalable component systems

PRICING & REQUIREMENTS

Cost Component Durable Relume
Platform $15-25/mo (all-in) Free + $192/yr Pro
Required Tools None included Webflow ($15-45/mo) OR Figma
Total Monthly $15-25/mo $31-53/mo
Annual Cost $180-300/year $372-636/year

üí° KEY INSIGHT: RELUME IS 2-3X MORE EXPENSIVE

Relume appears "free" but requires Webflow subscription ($15-45/mo) to actually publish. Durable is all-in pricing. Calculate total cost, not just base price.

FEATURE COMPARISON

Feature Durable Relume Winner
Speed to First Site ~30s AI generation ~15 min (assembly by pro) Durable
Design Skills Required None Significant Durable
Customization Depth Template-limited Unlimited (via Webflow) Relume
Learning Curve Minimal Steep (Webflow + Relume) Durable
Code Export ‚ùå No Via Webflow (HTML/CSS/JS) Relume
E-commerce Built-in Via Webflow (limited) Durable
Business Tools Built-in (CRM, invoicing) Requires integrations Durable
Design Consistency Template-based Component system Relume
Scalability Single sites Design system reusable Relume
Target User Non-designers, businesses Designers, agencies, pros Different markets

WHEN TO CHOOSE WHICH?

ü§ñ CHOOSE DURABLE IF:

  • ‚úì You have zero design skills
  • ‚úì You need a site today (not in weeks)
  • ‚úì Budget is limited ($15-25/mo vs $30-50+/mo)
  • ‚úì You're a solopreneur or small business
  • ‚úì You don't want to learn Webflow/Figma
  • ‚úì "Good enough" design is acceptable
  • ‚úì You need business tools (CRM, invoicing)
  • ‚úì E-commerce is important
  • ‚úì You want AI to do the work

üß© CHOOSE RELUME IF:

  • ‚úì You're a designer or agency
  • ‚úì You already know Webflow or want to learn
  • ‚úì You need custom, unique designs
  • ‚úì Building multiple client sites (scalable system)
  • ‚úì Design consistency across sites is critical
  • ‚úì Budget allows ($30-50+/mo total)
  • ‚úì You value component reusability
  • ‚úì You want professional-grade output
  • ‚úì You're building design systems

‚ö†Ô∏è BRUTAL HONESTY: WHO SHOULD NOT USE WHICH

DON'T CHOOSE RELUME IF:

You're a beginner. Relume requires Webflow knowledge (steep learning curve). You'll spend weeks learning before launching. If you're non-technical, Relume will frustrate you. Durable is designed for people like you.

DON'T CHOOSE DURABLE IF:

You're an agency building client sites. Durable's template limitations will constrain your creativity. You can't build custom design systems. Relume + Webflow gives you unlimited flexibility for professional work.

üí∞ ROI COMPARISON: WHEN RELUME'S COMPLEXITY PAYS OFF

Agency Example: Building 10 client sites/year. Relume component system saves ~5 hours per site = 50 hours saved = $5,000+ in billable time. Higher upfront cost pays for itself in scalability.

Solopreneur Example: One site for consulting business. Relume's 2-3x cost + steep learning curve = poor ROI. Durable gets you live in 30 minutes for $15/mo. Speed wins for single sites.
